required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characterizing Rate of Progression in USHer Syndrome (CRUSH) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Characterizing Rate of Progression in USHer Syndrome (CRUSH) Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Mutations in USH2A give rise to two phenotypes: Usher syndrome type 2a (USH2A) and nonsyndromic RP (USH2A associated nsRP). Usher syndrome is the most common form of congenital deafblindness. Patients with Usher syndrome are hearing impaired or profoundly deaf from birth and this can be rehabilitated with hearing aids or a cochlear implant. Furthermore, these patients develop retinitis pigmentosa (RP), a slowly progressive type of retinal degeneration that usually starts in the first or second decade of life. In both USH2A and nsRP patients the disease leads to severe visual impairment and eventually blindness around the 50th-70th year of life. There are no treatment options for the retinal degeneration. We do not know if they also suffer from balance complaints.
Currently, genetic therapy for Usher syndrome type 2 and USH2A associated nsRP is in development. But to measure the effect of a (genetic) therapy, it is crucial to know the detailed natural course of the visual and hearing deterioration over time. Several genetic therapy studies for other disorders are currently delayed, because the natural history of the disease has not been studied in detail previously.
The main objective is to map the natural course of the visual and hearing deterioration in Usher Syndrome 2 and USH2A associated nsRP for upcoming genetic therapy studies. Secondary objectives are: 1) To determine the necessary type of (combined) examinations, the sample size and length of studies (in years) essential to evaluate future genetic therapy in Usher syndrome. 2) To improve counselling of patients with Usher syndrome type 2 and USH2A associated nsRP with detailed information on the prognosis. 3) To identify additional etiological factors that explain variability in hearing impairment by adding questionnaires and psychophysical audiometric tests; and to assess the vestibular phenotype in Usher syndrome type 2 and USH2A associated nsRP patients.
This is a longitudinal, prospective natural history study. The study population consists of healthy human volunteers, 16 - 55 yr old with a confirmed genetic diagnosis of Usher Syndrome type 2 or and USH2A associated nsRP.
The main study endpoint is the natural course of the visual and hearing deterioration in Usher Syndrome type 2 and USH2A associated nsRP, over a time span of 4 years.
There are no risks associated with participation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived visual functioning
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Visual Functioning Questionnaire-48 (VFQ-48): score of difficulty of performing 48 activities (items). The score is determined using two formulas: 'average item score = total item scores / (48 - U)' in which activities for which a person has non-visual reasons not to do it or in which they are not interested are scored with 'U', and '0.9*LN((2.34-average item score) / (average item score+2.22))+0.05'. The higher the score, the lower the perceived visual functioning.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived handicap due to hearing impairment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Speech, Spatial and Qualities of Hearing Scale (SSQ): range 0-500, the higher the score, the fewer the perceived handicap due to hearing impairment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived handicap due to dizziness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Dizziness Handicap Inventory (DHI): range 0-100, the higher the score, the greater the perceived handicap due to dizziness.1. Pure tone audiometry and speech audiometry

primary_outcome.measure: Change in lifestyle adjustment due to Usher syndrome.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Usher lifestyle survey: qualitative questionnaire, no quantitative measures

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived health
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the 12-item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-12): 12 items with ranges 3-6, transformation of scores: ((patient score - lowest possible score)/range of scores)) * 100, the higher the score, the greater the perceived health.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the indication of depressive symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 years and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire Mood Scale (PHQ-9): range 0-27, the higher the score, the greater the indication of depressive symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in overall condition of the eye
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by full ophthalmic exam.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual acuity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by best-corrected visual acuity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual fields area
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by dynamic perimetry with topographical analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual fields sensitivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by static perimetry with topographical analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mean retinal sensitivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by fundus-guided microperimetry.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ellipsoid zone (EZ) area
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in retinal autofluorescence and Robson ring size
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in condition of the retina, macula, optic nerve and ocular vascularization
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by assessing stereo color fundus photography.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in rod- and cone-mediated retinal function
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every year until study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by full-field stimulus testing (FST).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in retinal function
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by full field electroretinogram amplitudes and timing in response to rod- and cone-specific stimuli.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in hearing thresholds
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by pure tone audiometry (PTA) and speech audiometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in auditory speech recognition abilities in noise
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the digits in noise test (DIN).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in integrity of the outer hair cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by otoacoustic emissions (OAEs).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in integrity of the inner hair cells, the synapse and the first stage on the auditory nerve
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and study completion at 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by electrocochleography (ECochG).

primary_outcome.measure: Vestibular function
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by rotational chair test and calorisation.

primary_outcome.measure: Function of individual vestibular semicircular canals
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by video head impulse test (HIT) test.

primary_outcome.measure: Function of saccule and utricule of the vestibular organ
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Measured by vestibular evoked myogenic potential (VEMP) test.

arm_group.description: Otherwise healthy human volunteers, 16-55 years old, with a confirmed genetic diagnosis of Usher Syndrome type 2 or non-syndromal USH2A related retinitis pigmentosa

study_pop.textblock: The Dutch Usher syndrome population consists of an estimated 850 patients. Additionally we would like to include patients with USH2A associated nsRP. Subjects will be recruited from this population. In the past years it has been clear that patients are highly motivated to participate in research for their disease. We aim to include 50 subjects and given our past experiences, we consider this a feasible number of participants. The study population consists of both males and females between 16 and 55 years of age with a confirmed genetic diagnosis of USH2A associated RP either syndromic or nonsyndromic.
